text: `] activate` on Julia <1.6 (IIRC) doesn't get you to the base environment but to the environment you started Julia with. From your example, it seems you didn't start Julia from the base environment but from an environment called `linter-julia`. I'm not sure there's a way to get to the base environment if you don't start with it (but if I remember correctly things are changing in 1.6).
